name: Inflation Nation
title: Skyrocketing Inflation Rates
description: Sudan's consumer price index reached an astronomical 38,796.56 in 2022, indicating a severe inflationary environment. The GDP deflator also soared to 462,510.92 in 2023, reflecting the country's economic instability.

name: Tariff Titans
title: High Tariff Barriers on Manufactured Goods
description: In 2021, Sudan imposed a weighted mean tariff rate of 26.8% on manufactured products, one of the highest globally, potentially hindering international trade and economic growth.

name: UN Aid Dependents
title: Significant Reliance on UN Aid
description: Sudan received $1,781,999.95 in net official flows from UN agencies in 2021, highlighting the country's dependency on international aid for economic support.

name: Monetary Mismatch
title: Imbalanced Money Supply and Reserves
description: The broad money to total reserves ratio in Sudan was 54.43% in 2017, indicating a potential vulnerability in the country's financial stability.

name: Expenditure Explosion
title: Surging National Expenditure
description: Sudan's gross national expenditure deflator reached 436,517.06 in 2023, reflecting a significant increase in national spending, which may not be sustainable in the long term.

name: Debt Overload
title: Minimal Total Reserves
description: In 2017, Sudan's total reserves were only 0.81% of its total external debt, indicating a significant vulnerability in managing external obligations.

name: Intellectual Property Payouts
title: High Intellectual Property Payments
description: In 2020, Sudan paid $1,642 million for the use of intellectual property, highlighting a dependency on foreign technologies and innovations.

name: Trade Troubles
title: Minimal Trade Activity
description: In 2023, Sudan's trade constituted only 2.47% of its GDP, reflecting limited engagement in global trade.

name: Economic Decline
title: Negative GDP and GNI Growth
description: Sudan experienced a severe economic downturn in 2023, with GDP growth at -20.11% and GNI growth at -19.06%.

name: Low Living Standards
title: Minimal GDP and GNI Per Capita
description: In 2023, Sudan's GDP per capita was only 311.38 LCU, and GNI per capita was 308.45 LCU, indicating low living standards.

name: Public Resource Inequity
title: Low Equity in Public Resource Use
description: Sudan's CPIA equity of public resource use rating was 1.5 in 2023, suggesting significant inequities in resource distribution.

name: Revenue Mobilization Challenges
title: Inefficient Revenue Mobilization
description: In 2023, Sudan's CPIA efficiency of revenue mobilization rating was 2, indicating challenges in effectively collecting revenues.

name: Service Sector Struggles
title: Minimal Service Sector Contribution
description: In 2023, services contributed only 7.48% to Sudan's GDP, reflecting a limited service industry.

name: Alcohol Abstinence
title: Lowest Alcohol Consumption
description: In 2020, Sudan had one of the lowest alcohol consumption rates globally, with only 0.01 liters per capita.

name: Tourism Expenditure
title: Minimal International Tourism Expenditure
description: In 2018, international tourism expenditures accounted for just 0.16% of Sudan's total imports, indicating limited tourism activity.

name: Vitamin A Deficiency
title: Low Vitamin A Supplementation
description: In 2022, only 1% of children aged 6-59 months received Vitamin A supplements, highlighting a public health concern.

name: Female Education Gap
title: Low Female Advanced Education
description: In 2022, only 24.83% of Sudan's female working-age population had advanced education, indicating a gender education gap.
